heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Ranking 6th, today's lightning strike count places it among the top days recorded since 11 April 2025.  The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 16 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (182°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 51.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.4°C) and outside temperature (down 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 5622 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 9125 lux), cloud levels (up 1020 m), and dew point temperature (down 2.3°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 74.8m lower than yesterday, 333.9m lower than the past week, 1019.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 645m to 1618m and averaged 912.1m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, very clammy and humid and winds will be practically absent. A few light raindrops may fall, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and periods of sunshine are expected. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.
